intro: Hymenatherum thurberi, commonly known as Thurber's senna, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its distinctive pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant produces bright yellow flowers with a unique, intricate pattern of veins. Its leaves are bipinnate, consisting of multiple small, feather-like leaflets. Hymenatherum thurberi thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along stream banks.
